CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . The relevant facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and her family members instituted proceedings before ORG ( PERSON ) in ORG , seeking division of their joint property .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG in ORG discontinued these proceedings and instructed the parties to initiate a separate civil case given a number of contentious issues .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s cousins brought a claim against the applicant and her parents before ORG in ORG . On DATE , the cousins lodged an additional claim concerning the same matter . Both claims were subsequently joined and examined in the same civil proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in ORG ruled against the applicant and her parents .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE upheld this judgment on appeal . The judgment , thereby , became final . It was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal on points of law ( revizija ) with ORG .
CARDINAL . This appeal was misplaced until DATE , when the applicant ’s lawyers intervened and urged the authorities to find it . On DATE the applicant amended her appeal on points of law .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal on points of law as unfounded . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
